title: So who beats Darius in top lane at the moment?
body: I had to go against a top lane Darius. I own almost the whole character list, but auto dodged when I froze looking at my champ list on which one could possibly counter him? Any suggestions? I thought of Riven, but I suck with her, and although I own Garen, I have never used him.

replies.body:
Anyone who can either stay out of his range and still damage him {{champion:41}} {{champion:131}} {{champion:126}} or anyone who can sit inside handle range and smack him around without worry {{champion:23}} {{champion:48}} {{champion:58}} 

Don't worry about losing lane to him, in the end it still doesn't matter because he's still shit at teamfighting against anyone who wards the flanks and has half a brain.

> Don't worry about losing lane to him, in the end it still doesn't matter because he's still shit at teamfighting against anyone who wards the flanks and has half a brain.

I'd argue he's definitely FAR better than he was at teamfighting, if only because a single successful execution can potentially lead to reset city; he can essentially sit near his carry for the first part of the fight; peel anyone who dives them off with his grab (kinda similar to what he used to do in teamfights), wait for a reset opportunity and then try to obliterate everything once he has his passive active.

Somewhat weaker in terms of being a lane bully though. Really the biggest advantage that new Darius has over old, is how easily he can get multiple dunks in a teamfight now, since his passive instantly applies full stacks of bleed (well that and the 40~200 bonus AD).

Even if he gets a single execution, he would have to be fighting a team of potatoes for anyone to let Darius hit them even once in teamfights. He's not like {{champion:55}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:18}} who jump all over the place once they reach reset city, the most he can do is walk up to them and outside of Bronze 6 no one is going to let that happen in a teamfight.

He's not like {{champion:55}} {{champion:11}} {{champion:18}} who jump all over the place once they reach reset city, the most he can do is walk up to them and outside of Bronze 6 no one is going to let that happen in a teamfight.

I mean, while Darius isn't exactly the most mobile guy on the block, he's not the WORST either (he does at least have his pull)

Also worth noting that, thats only accounting for Darius alone; you'd also need to bear in mind that his entire team is also likely there, at the very least he'll be able to attack the frontline (given that they'll be fighting his team; likely in melee range). That said, mostly the point of Juggernaughts (and he fits the bill the best honestly, not even having a slow cleanse like Garen; or any speed boost at all for that matter in his kit), he'll have a hell of a time getting to someone who can kite him properly; but he'll obliterate them if he can get there.
How to counter Darius: Play him

I would say Ganks, I've mained Darius for a long time so I have a pretty easy time winning lane, best thing to do is gank him hard before he gets any kills.

If you failed a gank and he gets away do not chase him to his tower, he will pull you and get a possible double. I've killed many junglers who thought they could finish me but got yanked under my tower and slowed.

I actually forgot about tryndamere, since Darius no longer has an AS slow you'll get cheesed out a lot, also your damage is based on TOTAL ad so his w substantially reduces your damage. With bleed being physical trynd can go into a tabi + vamp into like a shiv and really give darius a hard time.

I'd say {{champion:86}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:126}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:13}} {{champion:8}} these champions are a pretty good choice to pick against him and maybe{{champion:23}} I don't know if trynd can just a thought maybe try it out 1v1'ing a friend who has darius, 

Funny thing is I beat a darius top before as {{champion:121}} Lol.
Riven, Fiora. Trundle and Gnar are good choices.

{{champion:114}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:39}} Fiora is super fast and her dash lets her kite around his q and vitals give her ms/heal to let her out trade him and use the MS to also get out of his q also kind of hard to beat her in an all in around 6 as darius.

Riven can constantly e away from your q or e into you to deny the heal and she all good all in potential throughout most of the game.

Garen trades very well vs darius and since bleed is physical garen's match up vs darius is actually skewed towards garen now since you can start cloth with bleed being physical and all, also your lvl 6 all in is stronger than darius generally since you'll kill him very fast with your % hp execute before he can use his healing to an advantage.

Irelia can get favorable trades with her stun and minion aggro while dodging your edged q with her dash towards a minion or yourself while having a bit of sustain herself for fights.


{{champion:127}} {{champion:85}} Lots of ranged CC and can kite him super hard while having low mana costs(energy)

{{champion:41}} is a safe choice but he won't really beat darius just outscale his team fighting

{{champion:114}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:150}} {{champion:39}} {{champion:24}} {{champion:126}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:68}} {{champion:2}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:64}} all does well vs him if played correctly, and also he is gonna be easier to beat next patch with the nerfs.
Try Gnar, hes shit vs ranged champs, and if he tries to get on you, you can hop away, and your mega form can go toe to toe with him, ult him to the wall, stun him again with W and go ham.

{{champion:127}} top will still make him fairly miserable

idk how well {{champion:85}} actually does vs him (i assume well) but he sure as fuck frustrates me endlessly

Renekton is pretty good against him since he has sustain with his Q and he can engage or disengage with his W and E and he can use his ult to survive Darius's ult. He also has armor penetration in his kit too.
I've only laned against him twice as Lissandra, but both times I completely stomped the lane.

48-49% win rate as Darius doesn't mean those champions clearly counter him :( 
Well at least this is not enough to be reliable.

{{champion:92}} is pretty good, of all the times i've laned vs new darius thats the only champ I won hard as. I played {{champion:1}} vs him once and i killed him a few times and he did the same to me

I would suggest someone with range over him. I can see Gnar doing well as long as you save your hop for when he tries to pull you. On top of that, Gnar has the poke and %hp damage to deal with Darius's tankiness. Just don't let him land his pull as mini Gnar or he'll make a new loincloth out of you.

Riven, Fiora, and Heimer are the best matchups against him at the moment.
